comments:
Hardware Environment:

Software Environment:

Build: AC-4.2.0-200606131059


Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new log set called "abc"
2. Add a WAS activity log (attached) to the log set
3. Export the log set
4. Exit Eclipse, restart with a new workspace
5. Import log set
6. Select the WAS activity log and click Finish

Actual Results:
Nothing happens.  There is an error in the error log.

Expected Results:

Created an attachment (id=44326)
WAS activity log
TPTP does not contribute a WAS log

------- Additional Comment #8 From Sheldon Lee-Loy  2006-06-20 13:27 EST -------

This is a TPTP bug.  The reason this is happening is that one of the input 
fields for the was adapter is null.  Consider the scenario when one imports a 
was activity log that is in text format.  The was_home field does not need to 
be set.  As a result the was_home field value is null.  When importing the 
activity log a nullpointer exception occurs when calling the following line
at 
org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.logui.internal.wizards.ImportLogWizard.getUserInput
(ImportLogWizard.java:473):

	table.put(field.getId(), values.get(field.getId()));

The fix is to check for a null value as follows:

	Object value = values.get(field.getId());
	if (value != null)
		table.put(field.getId(),value);

I checked this fix and it works.
